headline.main: Does Exercise Slow the Aging Process?

docs.abstract: Almost any amount and type of physical activity may slow aging deep within our cells, and middle age may be a critical time to get the process rolling.
docs.snippet: Almost any amount and type of physical activity may slow aging deep within our cells, and middle age may be a critical time to get the process rolling.

docs.lead_paragraph: A nutritionist writes, “Maybe a few forays into ‘less healthy’ food options will satiate one’s appetite” and improve dietary patterns.
docs.snippet: A nutritionist writes, “Maybe a few forays into ‘less healthy’ food options will satiate one’s appetite” and improve dietary patterns.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, the Mexican government imposed a tax of about 10 percent on sugary drinks. Now, legislators are trying to roll it back, angering public health experts.

headline.main: Mexico Moves to Scale Back a Successful Tax on Soda
headline.print_headline: Mexico Moves to Scale Back a Successful Tax on Soda

docs.abstract: Mexico's Congress is considering proposal to lower experimental tax on soda; more than 70 percent of adults and one-third of young children in country are overweight, due in part to high rate of consumption of sugary soft drinks; advocates of tax are upset.
docs.snippet: Two years ago, the Mexican government imposed a tax of about 10 percent on sugary drinks. Now, legislators are trying to roll it back, angering public health experts.

docs.lead_paragraph: The home of Parma ham, trumpeting the benefits of a traditional Mediterranean diet, is urging consumers not to get into a prosciutto panic after a warning that processed meat can cause cancer.

headline.main: No Prosciutto Panic, Please: Italian Producers Respond to WHO Meat Alarm
headline.print_headline: No Prosciutto Panic, Please: Italian Producers Respond to WHO Meat Alarm

docs.snippet: The home of Parma ham, trumpeting the benefits of a traditional Mediterranean diet, is urging consumers not to get into a prosciutto panic after a warning that processed meat can cause cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: DuPont Co. said weak agricultural sales, a strong dollar and continued weakness in emerging markets contributed to a sharp decrease in third-quarter earnings.

headline.main: DuPont Reports Sharp Decrease in 3Q Profit
headline.print_headline: DuPont Reports Sharp Decrease in 3Q Profit

docs.snippet: DuPont Co. said weak agricultural sales, a strong dollar and continued weakness in emerging markets contributed to a sharp decrease in third-quarter earnings.

headline.main: Cutting Sugar Improves Children’s Health in Just 10 Days

docs.abstract: Obese children who cut back on their sugar intake see improvements in their blood pressure, cholesterol readings and other markers of health after just 10 days, a rigorous new study found.
docs.snippet: Obese children who cut back on their sugar intake see improvements in their blood pressure, cholesterol readings and other markers of health after just 10 days, a rigorous new study found.

docs.lead_paragraph: A panel of experts convened by the World Health Organization also said the increase in risk is so slight that most people should not be overly worried.

headline.main: Meat Is Linked to Higher Cancer Risk, W.H.O. Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Report Links Risk of Some Cancers to the Consumption of Processed or Red Meat

docs.abstract: World Health Organization panel concludes eating processed and red meat presents cancer risk which, while significantly lower than smoking or drinking alcohol, supports calls for reduced consumption.
docs.snippet: A panel of experts convened by the World Health Organization also said the increase in risk is so slight that most people should not be overly worried.

keywords.value: International Agency for Research on Cancer
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Almost everything we “know” is based on small, limited studies, and the limited conclusions are often overblown.

headline.main: Unexpected Honey Study Shows Woes of Nutrition Research

docs.snippet: Almost everything we “know” is based on small, limited studies, and the limited conclusions are often overblown.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eating processed meats like hot dogs, sausages and bacon can cause colorectal cancer in humans, and red meat is also a likely cause of the disease, World Health Organization (WHO) experts said.

headline.main: Bacon and Other Processed Meats Can Cause Cancer, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Bacon and Other Processed Meats Can Cause Cancer, Experts Say

docs.snippet: Eating processed meats like hot dogs, sausages and bacon can cause colorectal cancer in humans, and red meat is also a likely cause of the disease, World Health Organization (WHO) experts said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bacon, hot dogs and cold cuts are under fire: The World Health Organization threw its global weight behind years of doctors' warnings and declared Monday that processed meats raise the risk of colon and stomach cancer and that red meat is probably dangerous, too.

headline.main: UN Agency Links Hot Dogs and Other Processed Meat to Cancer
headline.print_headline: UN Agency Links Hot Dogs and Other Processed Meat to Cancer
